catalysts.thesis: Classic PDUFA run-up candidate with high volatility potential; approval would validate platform and drive significant rerating.
catalysts.catalyst_details: PDUFA FDA Decision for Anaphylm (Epinephrine Sublingual Film) on January 31, 2026; Corporate update expected early Jan.
catalysts.absorption_status: Unpriced; Stock down -0.85% recently, offering an optimal entry point before the typical 2-3 week pre-PDUFA ramp.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Market cap <$1B implies low expectations for a potential epinephrine standard-of-care shift.

catalysts.thesis: High-conviction PDUFA run-up play with imminent FDA decision and JPM Healthcare Conference tailwinds.
catalysts.catalyst_details: PDUFA FDA Decision for FILSPARI (Sparsentan) in FSGS scheduled for January 13, 2026; anticipated pre-announcement/data during JPM week (early Jan).
catalysts.absorption_status: Partially priced but momentum accumulating; +2.58% move on Jan 6 suggests traders are positioning for approval.
catalysts.risk: FDA Complete Response Letter (CRL) or label restriction.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Stock is trading below 52-week highs despite derisking events; options skew suggests bullish positioning.

catalysts.thesis: Dual catalyst setup: BLA acceptance confirms regulatory progress while Phase 3 data loom as a major repricing event.
catalysts.catalyst_details: Jan 6, 2026: FDA accepted Veligrotug BLA (PDUFA June 30); Topline Phase 3 data for Elegrobart (VRDN-003) due Q1 2026 (imminent watch).
catalysts.absorption_status: Unpriced; Market reaction to BLA acceptance was muted (+0.05%), ignoring the imminent Phase 3 asymmetric upside.
catalysts.mispricing_evidence: Valuation gap vs competitors in TED (Thyroid Eye Disease) market; muted response to regulatory de-risking.
